page.title: 08Tillingbourne Green.
page.content: Tillingbourne Green probably got its name from a farm that used to be nearby and a stream.the word Â£Tilling'means to work the land and the word Â£bourne' means a stream or boundary.The green was once woodland.There was a pond and wild strawberries were abundant.At night a nightingale could be heard singing.The etate around the green was built in 1948.It provided homes for people whose houses had been bombed during the Second World War.The estate was built on the old farm.Unfortunately the people complained about the wood and so it was cut down.Mrs.Coles is a lady who has lived in the area for thirty-five years.She has seen many changes in her life-time as the estate has gradually grown.
